Python-DocumentCloud¶

A modified version of the LA Times’ python-documentcloud project.

Python library for interacting with the DocumentCloud API.

DocumentCloud’s API can search, upload, edit and organize documents hosted in its system. Public documents are available without an API key, but authorization is required to interact with private documents.

Further documentation:

http://python-documentcloud.readthedocs.org https://www.documentcloud.org/help/api

class pythondocumentcloud.Document(d)¶

A document returned by the API.

annotations¶

Fetch the annotations field if it does not exist.

contributor¶

Fetch the contributor field if it does not exist.

contributor_organization¶

Fetch the contributor_organization field if it does not exist.

data¶

Fetch the data field if it does not exist.

delete()¶

Deletes this object from documentcloud.org.

entities¶

Fetch the entities extracted from this document by OpenCalais.

full_text¶

Downloads and returns the full text of the document.

full_text_url¶

Returns the URL that contains the full text of the document.

Fetch the annotations field if it does not exist.

Fetch the contributor field if it does not exist.

get_contributor_organization()¶

Fetch the contributor_organization field if it does not exist.

get_data()¶

Fetch the data field if it does not exist.

get_entities()¶

Fetch the entities extracted from this document by OpenCalais.

get_full_text()¶

Downloads and returns the full text of the document.

get_full_text_url()¶

Returns the URL that contains the full text of the document.

get_large_image(page=1)¶

Downloads and returns the large sized image of a single page.

The page kwarg specifies which page to return. One is the default.

get_large_image_url(page=1)¶

Returns the URL for the large sized image of a single page.

The page kwarg specifies which page to return. One is the default.

get_large_image_url_list()¶

Returns a list of the URLs for the large sized image of every page.

get_normal_image(page=1)¶

Downloads and returns the normal sized image of a single page.

The page kwarg specifies which page to return. One is the default.

get_normal_image_url(page=1)¶

Returns the URL for the “normal” sized image of a single page.

The page kwarg specifies which page to return. One is the default.

get_normal_image_url_list()¶

Returns a list of the URLs for the normal sized image of every page.

get_page_text(page)¶

Downloads and returns the full text of a particular page in the document.

get_page_text_url(page)¶

Returns the URL for the full text of a particular page in the document.

get_pdf()¶

Downloads and returns the full PDF of the document.

get_pdf_url()¶

Returns the URL that contains the full PDF of the document.

get_published_url()¶

Returns the url where the record is published if one has been provided.

get_related_article()¶

Returns a related article, if one has been provided.

get_sections()¶

Fetch the sections field if it does not exist.

Downloads and returns the small sized image of a single page.

The page kwarg specifies which page to return. One is the default.

get_small_image_url(page=1)¶

The page kwarg specifies which page to return. One is the default.

get_small_image_url_list()¶

large_image¶

Downloads and returns the large sized image of a single page.

The page kwarg specifies which page to return. One is the default.

large_image_url¶

Returns the URL for the large sized image of a single page.

The page kwarg specifies which page to return. One is the default.

large_image_url_list¶

Returns a list of the URLs for the large sized image of every page.

normal_image¶

Downloads and returns the normal sized image of a single page.

The page kwarg specifies which page to return. One is the default.

normal_image_url¶

Returns the URL for the “normal” sized image of a single page.

The page kwarg specifies which page to return. One is the default.

normal_image_url_list¶

Returns a list of the URLs for the normal sized image of every page.

pdf¶

Downloads and returns the full PDF of the document.

pdf_url¶

Returns the URL that contains the full PDF of the document.

published_url¶

Returns the url where the record is published if one has been provided.

put()¶

Save changes made to the object to DocumentCloud.

According to DocumentCloud’s docs, edits are allowed for the following fields:

  • title
  • source
  • description
  • related_article
  • access
  • published_url
  • data key/value pairs

Returns nothing.

related_article¶

Returns a related article, if one has been provided.

save()¶

An alias to ‘put that post changes back to DocumentCloud

sections¶

Fetch the sections field if it does not exist.

set_data(data)¶

Update the data attribute, making sure it’s a dictionary.

set_published_url(string)¶

Updates the published url back in the resources object so your changes can be property reflected in any future “puts.”

set_related_article(string)¶

Updates the related article back in the resources object so your changes can be property reflected in any future “puts.”

small_image¶

Downloads and returns the small sized image of a single page.

The page kwarg specifies which page to return. One is the default.

small_image_url¶

Returns the URL for the small sized image of a single page.

The page kwarg specifies which page to return. One is the default.

small_image_url_list¶

Returns a list of the URLs for the small sized image of every page.

thumbnail_image¶

Downloads and returns the thumbnail sized image of a single page.

The page kwarg specifies which page to return. One is the default.

thumbnail_image_url¶

Returns the URL for the thumbnail sized image of a single page.

The page kwarg specifies which page to return. One is the default.

thumbnail_image_url_list¶

Returns a list of the URLs for the thumbnail sized image of every page.

class pythondocumentcloud.DocumentClient(username, password, connection, base_uri=None)¶

Methods for collecting documents

delete(*args, **kwargs)¶

Deletes a Document.

get(id)¶

Retrieve a particular document using it’s unique identifier.

Example usage:

>> documentcloud.documents.get(‘71072-oir-final-report’)
search(query, page=None, per_page=1000)¶

### Modified by The Lens ###

Retrieve all objects that make a search query.

Example usage:

>> documentcloud.documents.search(‘salazar’)

Based on code by Chris Amico

search_count(query)¶

### Added by The Lens. ### Get the number of documents matching a query.

Example usage:

>> documentcloud.documents.search_count(‘salazar’)
upload(*args, **kwargs)¶

Upload a PDF or other image file to DocumentCloud.

You can submit either a pdf opened as a file object or a path to a pdf file.

Example usage:

# From a file path >> documentcloud.documents.upload( >> “/home/ben/sample.pdf”, >> “sample title” >>)

# From a file object >> pdf = open(path, ‘rb’) >> documentcloud.documents.upload(pdf, “sample title”)

Returns the document that’s created as a Document object.

Based on code developed by Mitchell Kotler and refined by Christopher Groskopf.

upload_directory(*args, **kwargs)¶

Uploads all the PDFs in the provided directory.

Example usage:

>> documentcloud.documents.upload_directory(“/home/ben/pdfs/”)

Returns a list of the documents created during the upload.

Based on code developed by Mitchell Kotler and refined by Christopher Groskopf.

class pythondocumentcloud.DocumentCloud(username=None, password=None, base_uri=None)¶

The public interface for the DocumentCloud API

class pythondocumentcloud.DocumentSet¶

A custom class for document lists associated with projects.

Allows some tweaks, like preventing duplicate documents from getting into the list and ensuring that only Document objects are appended.

class pythondocumentcloud.Entity(d)¶

Keywords and such extracted from the document by OpenCalais.

class pythondocumentcloud.Location(top, right, bottom, left)¶

The location of an Annotation.

class pythondocumentcloud.Mention(d)¶

A mention of a search found in the document.

class pythondocumentcloud.Project(d)¶

A project returned by the API.

delete()¶

Deletes this object from documentcloud.org.

document_list¶

Retrieves all documents included in this project.

get_document(id)¶

Retrieves a particular document from this project.

get_document_list()¶

Retrieves all documents included in this project.

put()¶

Save changes made to the object to documentcloud.org

According to DocumentCloud’s docs, edits are allowed for the following fields:

  • title
  • description
  • document_ids

Returns nothing.

save()¶

An alias to ‘put that post changes back to DocumentCloud

class pythondocumentcloud.ProjectClient(username, password, connection, base_uri=None)¶

Methods for collecting projects

all(*args, **kwargs)¶

Retrieve all your projects. Requires authentication.

Example usage:

>> documentcloud.projects.all()
create(*args, **kwargs)¶

Creates a new project.

Returns its unique identifer in documentcloud

Example usage:

>> documentcloud.projects.create(“The Ruben Salazar Files”)
delete(*args, **kwargs)¶

Deletes a Project.

get(id=None, title=None)¶

Retrieve a particular project using its unique identifier or it’s title.

But not both.

Example usage:

>> documentcloud.projects.get(‘arizona-shootings’)
get_by_id(id)¶

A reader-friendly shortcut to retrieve projects based on their ID.

get_by_title(title)¶

A reader-friendly shortcut to retrieve projects based on their title.

get_or_create_by_title(*args, **kwargs)¶

Fetch a title, if it exists. Create it if it doesn’t.

Returns a tuple with the object first, and then a boolean that indicates whether or not the object was created fresh. True means it’s brand new.

class pythondocumentcloud.Resource(d)¶

The resources associated with a Document. Hyperlinks and such.

class pythondocumentcloud.Section(d)¶

A section earmarked inside of a Document

pythondocumentcloud.is_valid_data_keyword(keyword)¶

Accepts a keyword submitted to the Document’s “data” attribute and verifies that is is safe and not one of the reserved words DocumentCloud does not allow.

Returns True is keyword is safe. Raises ValueError if it is not.

See: https://github.com/documentcloud/documentcloud/blob/master/config/initializers/entity_map.rb#L22 And: https://github.com/datadesk/python-documentcloud/issues/81

Usage:
Enables the use of multipart/form-data for posting forms
Inspirations:
Upload files in python:
http://aspn.activestate.com/ASPN/Cookbook/Python/Recipe/146306
urllib2_file:
Fabien Seisen: <fabien@seisen.org>
Example:

import MultipartPostHandler, urllib2, cookielib

cookies = cookielib.CookieJar() opener = urllib2.build_opener(urllib2.HTTPCookieProcessor(cookies),

MultipartPostHandler.MultipartPostHandler)
params = { “username” : “bob”, “password” : “riviera”,
“file” : open(“filename”, “rb”) }

opener.open(“http://wwww.bobsite.com/upload/”, params)

Further Example:
The main function of this file is a sample which downloads a page and then uploads it to the W3C validator.
pythondocumentcloud.MultipartPostHandler.getsize(o_file)¶

get the size, either by seeeking to the end.

A few toys the API will use.

exception pythondocumentcloud.toolbox.CredentialsFailedError¶

Raised if an API call fails because the login credentials are no good.

exception pythondocumentcloud.toolbox.CredentialsMissingError¶

Raised if an API call is attempted without the required login credentials

exception pythondocumentcloud.toolbox.DoesNotExistError¶

Raised when the user asks the API for something it cannot find.

exception pythondocumentcloud.toolbox.DuplicateObjectError¶

Raised when the user tries to add a duplicate to a distinct list.

pythondocumentcloud.toolbox.credentials_required(method_func)¶

Decorator for methods that checks that the client has credentials.

Throws a CredentialsMissingError when they are absent.

pythondocumentcloud.toolbox.retry(ExceptionToCheck, tries=3, delay=2, backoff=2)¶

Retry decorator published by Saltry Crane.

http://www.saltycrane.com/blog/2009/11/trying-out-retry-decorator-python/
